Plot: A powerful study of the women's movement in the U.S. from abolitionist days to the present that demonstrates how it has always been hampered by the racist and classist biases of its leaders.
Characters: George Francis Train, Frederick Douglass, Henry Ward Beecher, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Susie King Taylor, Ida B. Wells, William Lloyd Garrison, William McKinley, Harriet Tubman, Sojourner Truth, Elizabeth Cady Stanton, Sarah Moore Grimké, Charlotte Forten, Lucretia Mott, Angelina Grimké, Prince Hall, Susan B. Anthony, Mary Church Terrell, Prudence Crandall, Carrie Chapman Catt, Nannie Helen Burroughs, Lucy Stone, Frances Dana Barker Gage, Margaret Garner, Nathaniel P. Rogers, Charles Remond, Charlotte Woodward, Jane Lewis, Frances E.W. Harper, Sarah Remond, James Brooks, Henry Blackwell, George Downing, W. E. B. DuBois, Jenny Proctor, Lucy Terry Prince, Katy Ferguson, Margaret Douglass, Myrtilla Miner, Lottie Wilson Jackson, Anna Garlin Spencer, Edward Merrick, Mary Chase, Belle Kearney, Josephine St. Pierre Ruffin, Victoria Matthews, Maritcha Lyons, Gertrude Mossell, Dr. Susan McKinner, Sarah Garnett, Mrs. John Jones, Fannie Barrier Williams, Margaret Murray Washington, Mary S. Carey, Leonora O'Reilly, Mary McCleod Bethune, Charles W. Chesnutt, Francis J. Grimke, Benjamin Brawley, Robert H. Terrell, Anna Jones, Mary Talbert, Karl Marx
